step_name: Define Data Governance Policies and Standards

subprocess_flow.description: Define the overarching data governance framework, including the scope, objectives, and guiding principles. This involves identifying key stakeholders and their roles in the data governance process. The framework should align with the organization's strategic goals and regulatory requirements.

Identify and prioritize critical data domains that require specific governance policies and standards. This involves assessing the business value, risk exposure, and regulatory requirements associated with each data domain. The identified data domains will guide the development of targeted policies and standards.
success_criteria: Comprehensive list of prioritized data domains

subprocess_flow.description: Develop specific data governance policies for each identified data domain. These policies should address data quality, security, privacy, access, and retention. The policies should be clear, concise, and actionable, providing guidance to data stewards and other stakeholders on how to manage data assets effectively.
success_criteria: Comprehensive set of data governance policies covering key data domains

subprocess_flow.description: Establish data standards for data elements within each data domain. These standards should define data formats, data types, data validation rules, and data naming conventions. The data standards should promote data consistency, interoperability, and usability across the organization.
success_criteria: Comprehensive set of data standards for key data elements

subprocess_flow.substep_name: Review and Approve Policies and Standards
subprocess_flow.description: Review the draft data governance policies and standards with key stakeholders, including data stewards, data owners, and legal counsel. Incorporate feedback and revise the policies and standards as needed. Obtain formal approval from the Data Governance Committee and executive leadership.
success_criteria: Approved data governance policies and standards
